# Sidebar Configuration Patterns

## Table of Contents
1. [Basic Autogenerated Sidebar](#basic-autogenerated)
2. [Custom Sidebar with Categories](#custom-categories)
3. [Module-Based Book Structure](#module-book-structure)
4. [Collapsible Navigation](#collapsible-navigation)

## Basic Autogenerated {#basic-autogenerated}

```typescript
// sidebars.ts
const sidebars = {
  bookSidebar: [
    {
      type: 'autogenerated',
      dirName: '.',
    },
  ],
};
export default sidebars;
```

## Custom Categories {#custom-categories}

```typescript
const sidebars = {
  bookSidebar: [
    'intro',
    {
      type: 'category',
      label: 'Module 1: Introduction',
      items: [
        'module-1/index',
        'module-1/chapter-1',
        'module-1/chapter-2',
      ],
    },
  ],
};
```

## Module-Based Book Structure {#module-book-structure}

For educational books with modules and chapters:

```typescript
const sidebars = {
  bookSidebar: [
    {
      type: 'doc',
      id: 'curriculum-overview',
      label: 'Curriculum Overview',
    },
    {
      type: 'category',
      label: 'Module 1: Introduction to Physical AI',
      link: { type: 'doc', id: 'module-1/index' },
      items: [
        'module-1/what-is-physical-ai',
        'module-1/embodiment-significance',
        'module-1/application-domains',
      ],
    },
    // Additional modules...
  ],
};
```

## Collapsible Navigation {#collapsible-navigation}

```typescript
{
  type: 'category',
  label: 'Module Name',
  collapsed: true,  // Collapsed by default
  collapsible: true,
  items: [...],
}
```

## Best Practices

- Use `link: { type: 'doc', id: 'path' }` to make category labels clickable
- Set `position` in `_category_.json` for autogenerated order
- Use `sidebar_position` frontmatter for individual doc ordering
